title: Christian Lopez (footballer)
text:
Christian Lopez (born 15 March 1953) is a French former professional <a href="Association%20footballer">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>. As of 2021, he simultaneously works as <a href="sporting%20director">sporting director</a> and assistant coach for <a href="Championnat%20National%203">Championnat National 3</a> club <a href="ES%20Cannet%20Rocheville">Cannet Rocheville</a>.
Club career.
Lopez was born in <a href="A%C3%AFn%20T%C3%A9mouchent">Aïn Témouchent</a>, <a href="French%20Algeria">French Algeria</a>. In a 15-year professional career, he amassed <a href="Ligue%201">Ligue 1</a> totals of 429 games and 28 goals in representation of <a href="AS%20Saint-%C3%89tienne">Saint-Étienne</a> and <a href="Toulouse%20FC">Toulouse</a>. He won seven major titles during his spell with the former club – including two <a href="Double%20%28association%20football%29">doubles</a>– and shared teams with legendary <a href="Michel%20Platini">Michel Platini</a> in his final three seasons.
Lopez spent the <a href="1985%E2%80%9386%20French%20Division%202">1985–86 campaign</a> in <a href="Ligue%202">Ligue 2</a> with <a href="Montpellier%20HSC">Montpellier</a>, retiring at the age of 34 after a spell in amateur football with <a href="UMS%20Mont%C3%A9limar">UMS Montélimar</a>.
International career.
Over seven years, Lopez earned 39 <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a> for the <a href="France%20national%20football%20team">France national team</a> and scored once. He made his debut on 26 March 1975, in a <a href="Exhibition%20game">friendly</a> against <a href="Hungary%20national%20football%20team">Hungary</a> (2–0 win in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>).
Lopez was part of the squads that appeared in the <a href="1978%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1978</a> and <a href="1982%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1982 FIFA World Cup</a>s. He featured in four matches for the "Bleus" in the latter tournament, with the country finishing in fourth position.
Honours.
Saint-Étienne
